intro: Bomarea ovallei f. lutea, commonly known as the yellow-flowered bomarea, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the humid forests of southern Mexico. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has tuberous roots and produces clusters of small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically borne on slender pedicels and are often clustered in inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
